poem:
**The Measure of Time**

In the glance before  
the cups were full,  
hope flickered bright—

ancient yearnings  
trouble the heart—  
young and new  
dance in crowded rooms.

Time, a nimble thief,  
steals not the desire  
for tender blooms  

as seasons turn,  
and measured clocks  
lose their grip.
